entry.content: #kodm: Allen Renear on 'Oratio Obliqua' in the EDM. Much fun!

entry.title: @AllanRenear the problem isn't technological. The problem is that we have not worked out the semantics for we want to express. #kodm
entry.content: @AllanRenear the problem isn't technological. The problem is that we have not worked out the semantics for we want to express. #kodm

entry.title: The emerging #kodm productive problem seems to be metamodeling (as opposed to fixing existing best practices, for example)
entry.content: The emerging #kodm productive problem seems to be metamodeling (as opposed to fixing existing best practices, for example)

entry.content: …and that's what's distinctive about humanities data modeling #kodm

entry.title: @allenerenear when we model humanities data, we're modeling entities that only exist in virtue of intentionality-laden social activity #kodm
entry.content: @allenerenear when we model humanities data, we're modeling entities that only exist in virtue of intentionality-laden social activity #kodm

entry.title: @allanrenear What is distinctive about data modeling the humanities? INTENTIONALITY. The things we model would not exist otherwise #kodm
entry.content: @allanrenear What is distinctive about data modeling the humanities? INTENTIONALITY. The things we model would not exist otherwise #kodm

entry.title: Renear: what is distinctive about the humanities: things we model exist because of intentionality, grounded in social context #kodm
entry.content: Renear: what is distinctive about the humanities: things we model exist because of intentionality, grounded in social context #kodm

entry.title: Renear refactors FRBR to change entities to roles: story realized through symbol structure, embodied in another symbol structure... #kodm
entry.content: Renear refactors FRBR to change entities to roles: story realized through symbol structure, embodied in another symbol structure... #kodm

entry.title: @allanrenear How do you model reporting on someone else's assertion without asserting it yourself? Adding another tuple doesn't do it #kodm

entry.title: @AllanRenear points out that FRBR doesn't actually model inheritance, although people talk about it as if it did. #kodm

entry.title: .@AllenRenear: There is no inheritance in FRBR despite what the authors of the model say. #kodm
entry.content: .@AllenRenear: There is no inheritance in FRBR despite what the authors of the model say. #kodm

entry.title: .@allenrenear sees FRBR problem: where is inheritance if attributes are disjoint? (only work has subject, manifestation has typeface) #kodm
